intro: Althaea angulata, commonly known as the angular hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a distinctive angular appearance, giving it its common name. Althaea angulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its mucilage-rich properties.
